title: Gallery Talk: Teachers and Students
hero_caption: <p>Georgia O’Keeffe, <em>Blue and Green Music</em>, 1919/21. Alfred Stieglitz Collection, gift of Georgia O'Keeffe.</p>
description:
Georgia O’Keeffe’s modernism was profoundly influenced by the art education ideas of painter Arthur Wesley Dow, who was in turn inspired by Japanese art scholar Ernest Fenellosa. Join Woman’s Board Fellow Alice Boone in tracing a remarkable lineage of art education.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
